SEARCH
Package com.example.restful.api.service

Class UserService

java.lang.Object
com.example.restful.api.service.UserService
@Service public class UserService extends Object
Service class that handles business logic related to User management.

This class provides methods for user registration, data retrieval, updating, and soft deletion. It acts as a bridge between the controller layer and the repository layer.

All operations that involve validation or password encryption are performed here before persisting data to the database.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Mizan

  • Constructor Details

      public UserService()

  • Method Details

    • registerUser

      public void registerUser(com.example.restful.api.model.RegisterUserRequest request)
      Registers a new user into the system.

      This method validates user input, checks for duplicate usernames, hashes the user's password using BCrypt, and saves the new user.

      Parameters:
      request - the registration data provided by the client.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.web.server.ResponseStatusException - if the username already exists or validation fails.

    • getAllUsers

      public List<com.example.restful.api.entity.User> getAllUsers()
      Retrieves a list of all active users.
      Returns:
      a list of User objects with active status (status = 1).

    • getUserById

      public Optional<com.example.restful.api.entity.User> getUserById(Long id)
      Retrieves a user by their unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the user's unique identifier.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the User if found, otherwise empty.

    • updateUser

      public com.example.restful.api.entity.User updateUser(Long id, com.example.restful.api.entity.User userDetails)
      Updates an existing user's information.

      If the user does not exist, a RuntimeException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to update.
      userDetails - the new user data to be applied.
      Returns:
      the updated User entity.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the user is not found.

    • getUserByUsername

      public Optional<com.example.restful.api.entity.User> getUserByUsername(String username)
      Retrieves a user by their username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to search for.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the User if found.

    • deleteUser

      public com.example.restful.api.entity.User deleteUser(Long id)
      Soft deletes a user by changing their status to 0 (inactive).
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to deactivate.
      Returns:
      the updated User entity with inactive status.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the user is not found.
